intro: Elatostema sessile var. cyrtandrifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf elatostema, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptic to ovate in shape. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
